channel.title: audit if torbrowser-launcher GnuPG signature verification bypass attack applies to Whonix or other projects
channel.description:
Originally published at: https://www.whonix.org/blog/gpg-signature-verification-bypass
Issue of torbrowser-launcher using gpg command line. [or call it an issue of the gnupg interface and its difficulty using it inside scripts, unfinished python gpg libraries etc.] https://github.com/micahflee/torbrowser-launcher/issues/229 Whonix consistently uses gpg-bash-lib. I've checked, that it is not affected by this issue. I.e. explicitly defining sig file and data file. https://github.com/Whonix/gpg-bash-lib/blob/833da423f8d5e95fc08de1d68a0a544109dadbe4/usr/lib/gpg-bash-lib/modules.d/50_common#L281-L282 However, I welcome review for this issue and gpg-bash-lib generally. Also other (build) scripts using gpg may be affected.

item.title: audit if torbrowser-launcher GnuPG signature verification bypass attack applies to Whonix or other projects
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
github.com/Whonix/gpg-bash-lib

use gpg --batch mode 

as suggested by @DigitalBrains1 to torbrowser-launcher
https://github.com/micahflee/torbrowser-launcher/issues/229#issuecomment-204942240
by adrelanos on 03:18PM - 05 Apr 16
changed 1 files with 5 additions and 0 deletions.

Read full topic
